text:
i am running apache on mac os x 10.3.9, i had downloaded the apache2.0.54 version and i configured , 
built it and intalled it all went fine 
when i try to start the server from ApplicationPreferences/share/websharing its starting the web server 
and the config file still shows this message " Apache/1.3.33 (Darwin) configured -- resuming normal 
operations" after that if i try to start the web serve from the terminal it all together shows this error "no 
listening sockets available, shutting down, Unable to open logs " .
if followed the following steps to install the Apache-2.0.54
1)./configure --prefix=/usr/local/apache2
2)make
3)make install

i just want to know
1)  where the default apache is stored.
2) if i want to upgrade from apache1.3 to 2.0 do i need to give some other path to --prefix
creator: phanip@iniquus.com

text:
You are not reporting a bug in apache httpd, but rather a problem figuring out
how to configure your system.  You should address this type of issue on a user
support from such as 
http://httpd.apache.org/userslist.html
or an apple-related discussion forum.

Thanks for using Apache!
creator: slive@apache.org
